result.execSummary:
The defendant Armando Meza-Rodriguez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION AND EXTENDED  SUPERVISION:
Mental health evaluation.   Take all prescribed medications.
Absolute sobriety.
Cognitive Intervention program.

No contact with victim.
No contact with firearms.

Provide DNA sample.
All mandatory court costs, fees and assessments to be paid including DNA surcharge during the period of probation.  If revoked  to be paid out of defendant's prison funds at an amount to be determined by the DOC and as a condition of extended supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Court waives all nonmandatory costs due to inability to pay.
Restitution set at $0.00.

Court advised defendant of right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, ammunition, body armor, explosives and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

timeConds.notes: Defendant to complete treatment at the Day Reporting Center.  Huber release for work once DRC is completed, if DRC refuses to accept defendant due to the nature of crime then it shall convert to terms of probation.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Armando Meza-Rodriguez

records.descr: Request and Order to Correct Clerical Error in JOC

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Armando Meza-Rodriguez in court, in custody.  Attorney Heather L. Johnson in court for Armando Meza-Rodriguez.  Attorney Alexandria S. Carlson in court for State of Wisconsin. 

SPANISH INTERPRETER SWORN: Laura Salcido Blancas

Case in court for sentencing hearing. Sentencing proceeded. State has complied with victim notification. Statements by parties and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1.  The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 7 YEARS, with credit for 236 days time served, the term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 4 YEARS, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS. Court IMPOSED AND STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 3 YEARS.

*Court finds defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program if revoked.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION AND EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
Court sentenced the defendant to serve 12 MONTHS in the House of Correction, defendant to complete treatment at the Day Reporting Center; Huber release for work once DRC in completed, if DRC refuses to accept defendant due to the nature of crime, then it shall convert to terms of probation, which includes.  
-Mental health evaluation, take all prescribed medications.
-Absolute sobriety.
-Cognitive Intervention Program.
-No contact with victim.
-No contact with firearms.
-Provide DNA Sample.
-Court waives all non-mandatory costs due to inability to pay.
-Restitution set at $0.00.
-All mandatory court costs, fees, and assessments to be paid, including DNA surcharge, during the period of probation. If revoked, to be paid out of defendant's prison funds at an amount to be determined by the DOC and as a condition of extended supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

*Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, ammunition, body armor, explosives and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored. 

Filed: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, Pretrial Incarceration Credit.
Defense Letter from Maria O.  Received and Filed.  nk
Sentencing Memorandum.  Received and Filed. nk
Defense Letter from Gueiza M.  Received and Filed. nk

Defendant Armando Meza-Rodriguez in court with attorney Heather L. Johnson.  Defendant Armando Meza-Rodriguez in custody.  Alexandria S. Carlson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sworn as interpreter: Brenda Bartholomew
Case in court for plea/sentencing.  Parties have reached an agreement.  Plea negotiations set forth on the record and agreed upon by the parties.

AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon, he may never own or possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  Court ordered the defendant to provide a DNA sample.  

Defense requests an adjourned date for sentencing.  Court scheduled the matter as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 36, Rm 316 SB.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Armando Meza-Rodriguez in court, in custody.  Alexandria S. Carlson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sworn as interpreter: Daniel Lopez
Case in court for a plea and sentencing.  Defense does not appear.  Court rescheduled the matter.  Case adjourned to Branch 36, Rm 316 SB.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Heather L. Johnson in court, defendant Armando Meza-Rodriguez not in court, in custody.  Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW
Case set for Jury trial. Defense request an adjournment of trial and request case set for plea and sentencing. State does not object. Case adjourned, Branch 38.  **  All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Laura A. Crivello, Branch 36,  in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defense motion to adjourn trial; filed.

Attorney Heather L. Johnson in court, defendant Armando Meza-Rodriguez not in court, in custody.  Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Sworn as interpreter: Patrick O. Ryan.  Deputy Court Clerk: STW  
Case set for Final pretrial. Case remains in a jury trial posture. Defense placed pending issues on the record. Jury trial remains scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 8:15 am, Branch 38.
Defense request a new final pretrial date. Parties notified via email of new court hearing. Case adjourned, Branch 38.
filed.

Attorney Heather L. Johnson in court, defendant Armando Meza-Rodriguez not in court, in custody.  Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW
Case set for Plea/sentencing hearing.   Defense has received discovery and an offer and requests matter be set for final pretrial and jury trial.  Court orders case for adjourne, Branch 38.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 08:15 am.  Jury trial scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Attorney Heather L. Johnson in court, defendant Armando Meza-Rodriguez not in court, in custody.  Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW  Deputy Court Clerk: STW  
Case set for Plea/sentencing hearing.  Defense in receipt of an offer and discovery and request an adjournment. Court also in Jury Trial on another matter. Case adjourned, branch 38.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Attorney Heather L. Johnson in court, defendant Armando Meza-Rodriguez not in court, in custody.  Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The case in court for plea and sentencing hearing.  Defense has received discovery and the State's offer.  The defendant is currently in quarantine unable to appear for today's court proceedings.  Defense requesting a new plea and sentencing date.  
The court grants defense request.  The court order the matter adjourned back to Branch 38.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 13, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Attorney Heather L. Johnson in court, defendant Armando Meza-Rodriguez not in court, in custody.  Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW
Case set for Bail/Bond Hearing. Defense does not wish to address bail at this time and request matter be set for resolution. Case adjourned, Branch 38.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 23, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Armando Meza-Rodriguez in court with Attorney Heather L. Johnson.  Defendant Armando Meza-Rodriguez in custody.  John Daniel Flynn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sworn as interpreter:Laron Esau
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 38, Judge Wagner. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Defense to be heard on bail on the next date. Case is adjourned to Br. 38.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for March 4, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.

Defendant Armando Meza-Rodriguez in court with attorney Darryl Everett Smith.  Defendant Armando Meza-Rodriguez in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Armando Meza-Rodriguez appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4). 
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no contact with Harjit S
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Sworn as interpreter:  Fred Svensson
Sworn as interpreter:  Sarah Chwaszczewski for e-forming & interview with Atty Poznanski
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
